title: 103_hr1831
content: There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so the summarized curr_chunk is: "SECTION 1. BASIC PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS." "Amendment to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act includes training teachers, librarians, counselors, and personnel in gender-equitable education methods. It also involves evaluating gender equity in programs. Innovative projects now include training parents and personnel on the impact of gender-role socialization on educational needs." The curr_chunk discusses the impact of gender-role socialization on the educational needs of children and the use of gender-equitable educational practices. The curr_chunk amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to ensure gender-equitable instruction in schoolwide projects and includes training on the impact of gender role socialization on learning. The curr_chunk amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include gender equity training for chapter 1 personnel in cases of substantial differences in student participation or achievement by sex. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include gender-equitable education practices in training programs and ensure gender-equitable instruction in supported programs. Grants will be awarded accordingly. "Amendment to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 includes promoting gender equity and gender-equitable instruction in grant awards and local targeted assistance programs." SEC. 8 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include programs promoting gender equity in education by eliminating bias, identifying inequities, and implementing policies for gender equity. SEC. 9 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include teacher training in gender-equitable instruction in math and science. SEC. 10 addresses national programs. SEC. 10 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include a commitment to achieving gender equity in computer-use programs and teaching practices. SEC. 11 focuses on women's educational equity. SEC. 11 addresses women's educational equity by amending the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include gender considerations in model development and career education programs. SEC. 12 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include training for personnel in gifted and talented programs on gender-role socialization and gender-equitable education methods. SEC. 13 establishes the Secretary's Fund for Innovation in Education. SEC. 13 amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to include training programs for teachers on gender-role socialization and gender-equitable methods for computer-based instruction.
